metadata.title: CVE-2022-25310 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A segmentation fault (SEGV) flaw was found in the Fribidi package andaffects the fribidi_remove_bidi_marks() function of the lib/fribidi.c file.This flaw allows an attacker to pass a specially crafted file to Fribidi,leading to a crash and causing a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25310` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfribidi-bin - 0.19.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libfribidi0 - 0.19.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: fribidi package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.19.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
